meanings.definition: Writing or drawings scribbled, scratched, or sprayed illicitly on a wall or other surface in a public place.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti on the school wall was colorful and artistic.
meanings.sent2: People often see graffiti on buildings in the city.
meanings.sent3: The graffiti of a smiling sun made the alley look cheerful.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like graffiti on his heart, leaving a lasting mark.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti of a roaring lion was so vivid, it seemed ready to pounce.

meanings.definition: Inscriptions, figure drawings, etc., found on the walls of ancient sepulchers or ruins.
meanings.sent1: The ancient graffiti in the cave told stories of the past.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists study graffiti to learn about ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The graffiti on the tombstone seemed to whisper secrets of old.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the ruins was like a silent witness to history.
meanings.sent5: The faded graffiti on the wall hinted at forgotten tales of long ago.
